definition: to be fond of eating/to be gluttonous
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
happy to partake but not prepared to do any work (idiom)/all take and no give

sentences.english: I like boiled dumplings best . I think they are very delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜欢的就是水饺了，我认为它们很好吃。

sentences.english: Wife, is not good-looking, but net, delicious cheap.
sentences.chinese: 老婆，是刀鱼，不好看，但好吃便宜啊。

sentences.english: He flew into a rage, but was still too lazy to work.
sentences.chinese: 他气坏了，但仍旧好吃懒做。

sentences.english: I'll just make a nice risotto .
sentences.chinese: 我会做超好吃的意大利饭。

sentences.english: B. The food tasted bad, however Aunt Kit fixed it.
sentences.chinese: 饭菜不好吃，可姬特姑妈还往里加调味料。

sentences.english: Nettle cloth is as good as linen cloth.
sentences.chinese: 荨麻在嫩时，叶子是一种非常好吃的蔬菜。

sentences.english: JAF and friends concluded that the steak was the best among all that we had eaten.
sentences.chinese: 我们一致认为牛排是这一顿当中最好吃的了。

sentences.english: The largest and most delicious peaches come from Fengcheng.
sentences.chinese: 最大最好吃的桃产于风城。

sentences.english: You don’t want to go encouraging of them. They’re scum.
sentences.chinese: 你不能鼓励他们好吃懒做，这可是些瘪三。

sentences.english: No ice cream in the world is more delicious than American ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 世界上没有哪个地方的冰激淋比美国的更好吃了。

sentences.english: If you salt the vegetables with a little onion salt, they will taste better.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在蔬菜里加点葱头盐，就会更好吃一些。

sentences.english: Introduce to me quickly, what's delicious in Beijing?
sentences.chinese: 快给我介绍介绍，北京有什么好吃的？

sentences.english: I had never seen as much good food in my life, and I chowed down.
sentences.chinese: 我人生中从来没见过这么多好吃的东西，我吃了个饱。

sentences.english: These original barbeques would have improved the texture and taste of the food, as well as making it easier to digest.
sentences.chinese: 这种原始烤肉使食物更好吃，同时使食物更易消化。

sentences.english: Lori , Lori wrinkled and said "nah…" to the mushroom.
sentences.chinese: 萝莉，萝莉皱眉说香菇不好吃。
